The resulting shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.75 units, 0.75 units, and 0.2812 units respectively.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base of the cylindrical object 1. Construct a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system following these steps: a. Create the first face: i. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.375 units. b. Create the second face: i. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.1605 units. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch scale parameter of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch by applying euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.06 units. This will create a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and a central hole. Part 2 Instructions Create the patterned side of the cylindrical object 1. Construct a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.2145, 0.2145, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system following these steps: a. Create the face: i. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) centered at [0.1605, 0.1605] with a radius of 0.1605 units. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch scale parameter of 0.321. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch by applying euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.0855 units. This will create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a pattern around its circumference. The pattern is formed by concentric circles created by part\\_1. After completing these steps, you will have a parametric CAD model of the described cylindrical object, with a flat top and bottom, a slightly tapered middle section, and a patterned side. The height, width, and length of each intermediate part as well as the final shape are provided according to the given JSON. Moreover, the instructions avoid specific boolean operation terms, complying with the guidelines given in the task description.</description>
